resources.string: Is your phone a low-ram device? You decide!
This IS a Low RAM Device!
This is NOT a Low RAM Device!

This app toggles a few lines of code that was added in KitKat used by some apps to detect if a device is high-end or low-end and can use that to optimize it for the phone\'s less powerful stats.\nThis may have a major effect (results not guaranteed) that can speed up some apps when enabled, and allow you to use more features in those in trade for performance.

ActivityManager.isLowRamDevice() is a method introduced in Android 4.4 KitKat. It is used by some newer apps to enable simple or limited features to prevent slowing down an entry-level Android device and is flagged using a line in build.prop.

 This was added into the Android Support Library as ActivtyManagerCompat.isLowRamDevice().

 HOWEVER, it will always return false if you are on Jelly Bean (4.3) or below. This forces the isLowRamDevice() to either return the default value, true, or false. When true, you can allow apps optimized for isLowRamDevice() to use the trimmed-down features which can improve performance, or if false, allows those said apps to load all features in trade for less performance.

See the developer docs for more info.
